title: Imagination to Address SoC Security and Heterogeneous Computing at the Linley Processor Conference 2015
text:
Imagination to Address SoC Security and Heterogeneous Computing at the Linley Processor Conference 2015 September 28, 2015 13:47 ET | Source: Imagination Technologies 
LONDON, Sept. 28, 2015 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Imagination Technologies (IMG.L) announces that its experts will discuss next-generation SoC security and heterogeneous computing at the Linley Processor Conference 2015. The Linley Conference is a two-day event focused on system design issues, featuring technical presentations on embedded processors for communications, IoT, and advanced automotive systems. Who: Imagination, a global leader in multimedia, processor, communication and cloud technologies What: Imagination presentations at the Linley Processor Conference include: - Connected, Heterogeneous and Ubiquitous: Securing SoCs in the IoT Era : John Min, Imagination's director of processor technology marketing, will discuss the need for hardware separation-based security across all processors in heterogeneous SoCs, enabling the creation of IoT products that are trusted and robust – Tuesday, October 6th at 3:40 p.m. Pacific - Heterogeneous Systems Architecture: Coming Soon to a Platform Near You : Jim Nicholas, Imagination's vice president of MIPS business operations, will deliver a presentation on behalf of the HSA Foundation to share important new developments that are bringing the industry closer to broad adoption of heterogeneous computing – Tuesday, October 6th at 10:50 a.m. Pacific During the reception, Imagination will highlight its technologies including MIPS CPUs, PowerVR multimedia and Ensigma connectivity IP families, along with the latest OEM products using these solutions. Attendees can view these demonstrations at Imagination's exhibit on Tuesday, October 6th from 5:10 p.m. – 6:40 p.m. Pacific. When: Linley Processor Conference will be held October 6th and 7th, 2015 Where: Hyatt Regency Santa Clara, 5101 Great America Parkway, Santa Clara, CA 
Says Linley Gwennap, principal analyst and conference chairperson, The Linley Group: "The Linley Processor Conference gives attendees the critical information they need to select the best processor technology for their designs." 
More details about the Linley Processor Conference 2015 are available at http://www.linleygroup.com/events/event.php?num=35 . 
About Imagination Technologies 
Imagination is a global technology leader whose products touch the lives of billions of people across the globe. The company's broad range of silicon IP (intellectual property) includes the key processing blocks needed to create the SoCs (Systems on Chips) that power all mobile, consumer and embedded electronics. Its unique software IP, infrastructure technologies and system solutions enable its customers to get to market quickly with complete and highly differentiated SoC platforms. Imagination's licensees include many of the world's leading semiconductor manufacturers, network operators and OEMs/ODMs who are creating some of the world's most iconic products.
